"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents provide information on the protection and safety measures in an X-ray department. The parameters of a film-screen-combination are listed in the directive to section 16 of the german X-ray Regulation. It is mentioned that poor storage and transport conditions may adversely affect the quality of X-ray films. There is no direct mention of sensitivity to X-rays, but we can infer that certain tissues might be more sensitive based on their biological characteristics.

The documents do not specifically state which tissues are most sensitive to X-rays, so we need to rely on general biological knowledge. Tooth buds and salivary glands are highly sensitive tissues, as they are essential for the development of teeth and saliva production.

On the other hand, hair and nails are relatively non-sensitive tissues that are mostly composed of dead cells or keratin. Cartilage is a connective tissue that is relatively less sensitive to X-rays compared to other tissues like nerve and muscle tissue.

Nerve and muscle tissue are also highly sensitive to X-rays, as they contain high concentrations of proteins and other biological molecules that can be damaged by ionizing radiation.

In conclusion, based on general biological knowledge and the lack of specific information in the documents, tooth buds and salivary glands seem to be the most sensitive tissues to X-ray exposure.",
